japanese: これ、さっき行った首里城だ。
translation: This is that Shurijo Castle we went to earlier.

japanese: あ！　ウミカジテラスの絵もあるのね！
translation: Ah! There's also a picture of Umikaji Terrace!

japanese:
気持ちはわかるわ。
やっぱり、この場所の景色は描きたくなるわよ。
translation:
I understand how the artist feels.
The scenery of this place makes you want to draw it.

japanese: うん、私も同じとこで写真撮ったし。
translation: Yeah, I took a photo at the same spot.

japanese:
二乃に三玖か？
なにを見てるんだ？
translation:
Nino and Miku, eh.
What are you looking at?

japanese: あ、２人とも。
translation: Ah, it's you two.

japanese:
手書きのポストカードよ。
ほら、沖縄の風景が描かれてるの。
translation:
Oh, we're looking at hand-drawn postcards.
Look, they have illustrations of Okinawa's scenery.

japanese:
わあ……。
すごく丁寧なイラストですね。
translation:
Wow...
The illustrations are really detailed.

japanese:
地元のアーティストが描いてるみたい。
よく知る景色だからこそって感じよね。
translation:
It seems like a local artist drew them.
It's because they're familiar with the scenery.

japanese: ええ、どれもその場所の情景が浮かんできます。
translation: Yes, all of them evoke the scenery of each place.

japanese:
この大きな橋の絵は……
名前が書いてあるけど、なんて読むんだろ？
translation:
What about this big bridge...
The name's written, but how do you read it?

japanese: ああ、それは古宇利（こうり）大橋よ。
translation: Oh, that's Kouri Bridge.

japanese: よく知ってるね。
translation: You know your stuff.

japanese:
古宇利島に行ってみたくて、ちょっと調べたの。
まあ、今回は機会がなさそうだけど。
translation:
I wanted to visit Kouri Island,
so I did some research. Well, it doesn't seem
like we'll have the chance this time.

japanese:
確か、海の上を貫く橋で
沖縄でも有数の絶景として有名なんだよな。
確かに、この絵を見ただけでも納得だ。
translation:
I heard it's a famous scenic spot in Okinawa,
with a bridge that spans over the sea.
I can understand why just by looking at this picture.

japanese: こちらの絵は……青の洞窟？
translation: What about this one... Is it the Blue Cave?

japanese:
それも聞いたことがあるな。
有名なダイビングスポットじゃなかったか？
translation: I've heard of that too. Isn't it a famous diving spot?

japanese: こっちの森みたいな絵も綺麗よ。
translation: This forest-like illustration over here is beautiful too.

japanese: その絵はどこだろうな――
translation: I wonder where it is%p-2;――

japanese:
本当に、沖縄って名所がたくさんあるんだ。
見たことない景色がいっぱい。
translation:
There really are so many famous places in Okinawa.
With so many views I've never seen before.

japanese:
ここのポストカードに描かれているのが
全部ってわけでもないだろうしな。
translation:
But I don't think everything in Okinawa
is illustrated in these postcards.

japanese:
沖縄のすべてを楽しもうと思ったら、
数日では足りませんね。
translation:
If we want to fully enjoy Okinawa,
we'll need more than just a few days.

japanese:
もっと長く日程を取ればよかったかな。
そうすれば色々な場所へ行けたのに。
translation:
Maybe we should have taken a longer trip.
Then we could have gone to more places.

japanese:
いっそのこと、貸別荘を借りて
１か月くらい滞在するのもありじゃないかしら。
translation:
Well, why don't we rent a villa
and stay for about a month?
That would be a great way to fully enjoy Okinawa.

japanese:
それいいかも。
沖縄を楽しみ尽くせる旅になるよ。
translation:
That's a great idea.
It would be the ultimate trip to enjoy Okinawa.

japanese:
（貸別荘で１ヶ月……。
　庶民の俺には想像できない旅だ……）
translation:
(Renting a villa for a month...
 That's a trip I can't even imagine as a commoner...)

japanese: そ、それはいけませんよ！？
translation: Th-that's not good, is it?!

japanese: え？　どうして？
translation: Huh? Why?

japanese: 楽しいと思うけど。
translation: I think it'd be fun.

japanese:
だ、だって！
男性と１つ屋根の下だなんて……
さすがにそれはどうかと思いますっ！
translation:
B-because! Living under one roof with a man...
that's not appropriate, is it?

japanese: はあっ！？
translation: WHAAA?!

japanese: ああ、そういう意味ね。
translation: Oh, I see what you mean.

japanese:
フータローとは無人島で暮らしたこともあるのに。
今更だよ。
translation:
You've lived on a deserted island with Futaro before,
so it's too late to be worried about that now.

japanese:
う……。
それはそうですけど……。
translation:
Ooh...
Well, that's true...

japanese: それにあんた、そんなことで照れてる場合？
translation: Besides, you're blushing over something like this?

japanese: え？
translation: Huh?

japanese: どうせ将来はフー君と同棲するんでしょ？
translation: In the end, you're going to live with Fu-kun, right?
Ah...

japanese: ど、ど、同棲……！
translation: L-living together!

japanese:
なにを真っ赤になってるんだ。
変な想像すんなって。
translation:
What are you getting all red for?
Don't imagine weird things.

japanese:
へへへ、変な想像なんてしてませんよ！？
普通の想像をしていただけです！
translation:
I-I-I, I wasn't imagining anything weird!
I was just imagining normal things!

japanese: 普通の想像って、なんだそりゃ。
translation: What exactly do you mean by 'normal'?

japanese:
（でもまあ、二乃の言う通り……
　いつかはそういう日も来るよな）
translation:
(But, well, as Nino said...
 that day might come eventually.)

japanese:
とは言っても
まだそんな先のこと、想像もできないよな。
translation:
Even so, it's hard to imagine
something so far off in the future.

japanese: 想像は確かに難しいですが――
translation: Imagining it is certainly difficult, but%p-2;――

japanese:
まあ、いずれはな。
そういう時も来るかもしれんが。
translation:
Well, eventually.
That time might come too.

japanese: 否定しないんだ。
translation: You're not denying it.

japanese:
否定することじゃないだろ？
これから先を考えれば。
translation:
There's no need to deny it, right?
If you think about the future.

japanese: そ、そうですね……。
translation: Y-yeah...

japanese:
とは言っても
まだそんな先のこと、想像もできないよな。
translation:
Even so, it's hard to imagine
something so far off in the future.

japanese: 想像は確かに難しいですが――
translation: Imagining it is certainly difficult, but%p-2;――

japanese: 同棲というか家族に……。
translation: Living together, like a family...

japanese: かっ、家族！？
translation: A f-family?!

japanese:
いや、五月は、その……
結婚のことまで考えて返事をしてくれたんだろ？
translation:
I mean, Itsuki, um...
You did say you were considering marriage, right?

japanese: ええ、確かに言ってたわ。
translation: Yeah, she did say that.

japanese: か、家族……。
translation: F-family...

japanese: ……五月？
translation: ...Itsuki?

japanese: フリーズしてる。
translation: She's frozen.

japanese: お、おい、大丈夫か？
translation: H-hey, are you alright?

japanese: はっ！！
translation: WHAAA!!

japanese:
す、すみません、大丈夫です。
ちゃんと正気に戻りました。
translation:
E-excuse me, I'm alright.
I'm back to my senses.

japanese:
そうですよね、いつかは本当に上杉く――
風太郎と一緒に暮らす日が……。
translation:
Yes, some day when I actually live with you, Uesu%p-2;――
%p;Futaro...

japanese:
とは言っても
まだそんな先のこと、想像もできないよな。
translation:
Even so, it's hard to imagine
something so far off in the future.

japanese: 想像は確かに難しいですが――
translation: Imagining it is certainly difficult, but%p-2;――

japanese:
きっと楽しい暮らしになります。
いえ、絶対にしてみせますっ！
translation:
I'm sure it will be a fun life together.
No, I'll definitely make it happen!

japanese: お、おう、そうだな。
translation: Y-yeah, I think so too.

japanese:
（どうなるかは想像できないとはいえ、
　五月の言う通り、楽しいのは間違いないか）
translation:
(I can't imagine what it will be like,
 but as Itsuki said, it's definitely going to be fun.)

japanese:
ど、どうでしょう？
いまのうちから家具を考えておきませんか？
ほら、どんなソファがいいとか！
translation:
W-what do you think?
Why not start thinking about furniture now?
Like what kind of sofa we want!

japanese:
いくらなんでも気が早いと思うが……
まあ、俺は座り心地がよければなんでもいい。
translation:
I think it's a bit too early for that...
But as long as it's comfortable to sit on,
I don't really mind.

japanese: それは範囲が広すぎません！？
translation: Isn't that too broad of a range?!

japanese: ……２人の空間になってる。
translation: ...It's becoming their own little space, isn't it.

japanese:
まったく。
ちょっと茶化そうと思っただけなのに
見せつけてくれちゃって。
translation:
Geez.
I was just trying to tease them a little,
and they had to go and show me up like this.

japanese:
けど、さっきも話したけど、
五月がここまで積極的になるのはやっぱり意外。
translation:
But, as I mentioned earlier,
it's surprising how proactive Itsuki has become.

japanese:
沖縄に来てから変わった気がする。
理由はわからないけど。
translation:
I feel like she's changed since coming to Okinawa.
I don't know why, though.

japanese: なんにせよ、時と場合を考えて欲しいわねぇ。
translation:
In any case, I want her to consider
the timing and situation.
